<div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Drilling\u002FWell Operations \n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    WESTHILL (ABD)-TARLAND RD(GBR) \n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    United Kingdom \n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Job Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    Supporting the Central North Sea Asset, this is an exciting opportunity to join an innovative and progressive team within our Technical Services department here at TotalEnergies E&amp;P UK Ltd.\n    <br> \n    <br> This role reports into the Lead Drilling Engineer.\n    <br> \n    <br> Within technically challenging areas, with budgetary and time constraints, the role will play an important role in optimising well operations and ensuring that wells are fit for purpose. As well as developing the asset D&amp;W strategy for tackling technical challenges.\n    <br> \n    <br> This vacancy will close for applications on 8th February 2023.\n    <br> \n    <br> You can expect to be warmly welcomed by your colleagues in the multi-disciplinary Drilling and Wells team, where you will be responsible for a diverse range of activities including...\n    <br> \n    <ul>\n     <li> Core activity: Design &amp; preparation of wells in accordance with UK regulations &amp; internal company rules. To include:\n      <ul>\n       <li> Coordination of the well delivery process. Creation of supporting documentation in conjunction with the drilling engineer; Drilling Programme, HAZID \u002F HAZOP, DWOP, Pre-spud, HSE Notification, governmental applications &amp; consents, MoC and RA, derogations, abandonment plans, end of well reports, after action reviews, experience sharing (anticipate REXs, lessons learned), SIMOPS &amp; bridging Documents etc.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Lead the Well Scope of Requirement (WSOR) process from within the drilling &amp; wells team. Input to the WSOR to ensure the well delivery process is managed correctly<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Providing live drilling engineering support to operations (casing design, directional, hydraulics, swab and surge, torque and drag, well control calculations etc.)<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Well project interface, when necessary, liaison with internal departments; asset, subsurface, reservoir, well performance, completion, testing, intervention, contracts &amp; procurement, well examination etc.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Prepare \u002F review budget and duration estimates, raise related Contract Release Orders and Service Orders.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Follow rig cost control, advise of any budget over-spend &amp; follow-up end of well cost reporting<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Update and follow-up of the rig cost control for service contracts involved in drilling and completion operations<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Well design &amp; delivery optimisation through applications of safe working practices, application of new technology &amp; implementation of a drilling improvement plan (well performance improvement). Understanding of Greenhouse Gas Emissions &amp; reduction plans.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Support the offshore workforce through communication, interaction &amp; problem solving<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Equipment: Recommend equipment type &amp; quantity including long lead items in conjunction with the QAQC &amp; procurement team. Follow equipment development &amp; qualification where necessary. Track equipment through the supply chain &amp; prepare for well programme changes<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Master â€˜HPHT specialtiesâ€™, such as HP\u002FHT casing design in WellCAT and Managed Pressure Drilling operations<\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful><\u002Fli>\n     <li> Studies: Undertake technical studies during the well planning process &amp; supervise small task forces to resolve engineering \u002F technical issues, ad-hoc support on pre-FID projects (technical, Time, Cost).<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Contract Management: manage the technical aspect of multiple contracts in your field of speciality including day-to-day activity, budget control, service quality reviews &amp; tendering of multi-service line contracts. Have the ability to negotiate revised rates and\u002For terms &amp; conditions where necessary.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Delegation: Delegate for the Lead Drilling Engineer and Drilling &amp; Completion Superintendent<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Assist the Lead Drilling Engineer and demonstrate commitment to safety<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Learn &amp; develop Continuous Improvement Projects \u002F Lean initiatives<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Perform the Technical Interface role between Company and its partners.  United Kingdom \n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Job Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    If you are a Technical Expert in the Process discipline, but also enjoy working with People and Teams then TotalEnergies have a great opportunity for you!\n    <br> \n    <br> We are looking for an enthusiastic Engineer to join our team onshore in our Westhill Office.\n    <br> \n    <br> The North Alwyn and Dunbar are mature assets, that come with associated production, cost, asset &amp; well integrity challenges.\n    <br> \n    <br> Alwyn Area needs a Process Engineer who is capable of providing technical\u002Fengineering advice and support in relation to process engineering.\n    <br> \n    <br> As a budget spender, you will also be responsible for ensuring that jobs are done efficiently and without exceeding approved budgets.\n    <br> \n    <br> As part of the NNS Asset, and its aim to make agile working a regular activity, every asset team member should expect to be nominated to work in small, short duration task forces on various subjects (not necessarily associated with their core discipline) for up to 20% of the time. As well as fully engaging with applicable Continuous Improvement initiatives.\n    <br> \n    <br> Closing Date: 15th February 2023\n    <br> \n    <br> Key activities;\n    <ul>\n     <li> Maintain master UniSim models for Alwyn and Dunbar and benchmark models following any significant process changes. <\u002Fli>\n     <li>Perform process engineering calculations, including relief valve, control valve, restriction orifice and line sizing.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Perform process studies for plant modifications related to process discipline or multi-discipline. <\u002Fli>\n     <li>Ensure appropriate process engineering input to HAZOPs, HAZIDs, Risk Assessments, SIL assessments and other technical safety assessments\u002Faudits, both during the actual assessment and during subsequent action resolution.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Provide process engineering input to Alwyn Area development and optimisation studies. <\u002Fli>\n     <li>Provide assistance to Alwyn Area Shutdown team and SMART Room for facility planned shutdowns.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Ensure preparation of clear, concise and comprehensive RFM dossiers, and ensure effective handover for detailed engineering and implementation.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Definition of modifications to improve safety, reliability, efficiency, production, environmental and cost performance.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Provide SMART room personnel with direct technical support ensuring continual cost effective improvement of process equipment in support of maximising production safely. <\u002Fli>\n     <li>Provide cover for the SMART Room Process Engineers.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Analyse and resolve production\u002Fprocess issues utilising appropriate techniques, liaising with other departments where necessary.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Develop and maintain good working relationships with asset site personnel, other TEP UK business units and 3rd party contractors and vendors through effective communication and regular site visits.<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Candidate profile<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    <ul>\n     <li>Degree in Chemical \u002F Process Engineering or equivalent, with an expectation to progress towards Chartership.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Appropriate post graduateship experience (2 years as a minimum) in the oil and gas industry, including offshore\u002Fsite experience. Maintaining the network of charge points to the highest standards and working in compliance to all Safety standards upheld by TotalEnergies and the Companies policies.\n    <br> \n    <br> \n    <b>Responsibilities for this role will include but are not limited to:<\u002Fb>\n    <ul>\n     <li> Dispatching of engineers and formulation of route for engineers to allow for minimal travel time.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Monitoring the IMS, EVP and Ticketing Systems and assigning interventions to Engineers.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Carry out the commissioning of equipment on site in accordance with Company rules.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Installation and repair, with a knowledge of electrical requirements, rules and H&amp;S,<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Carrying out diagnosis and fault finding â€“ which may include the fitting new parts on equipment,<\u002Fli>\n     <li> reimaging the OS, configuring and restoration of IT parameters.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Carry out the half yearly Safety Checks on the equipment following the company procedures.<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Context and environment<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    Source London is one of the largest providers of on street chare points in London. Maintaining a network of over 1500 charge points with a reliability rate of 98%. Each site has a Feeder pillar and between 1 and 5 charge points. The sites are mostly located curb side on public streets. Allowing EV users to park and charge in any bay with its dedicated charge point. The Charge points require a yearly safety check and bi yearly RCD safety test. During the rest of the year we maintain a responsive and preventative maintenance programme to keep the charge points and feeder pillars healthy and safe to use\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Candidate profile<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    <ul>\n     <li>Basic knowledge in IT, including Office Pack basic practice, computer environment, pc and network would be advantageous.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> 3 years + experience as maintenance technician.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> A clean and valid driverâ€™s license.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Ability to troubleshoot equipment and perform the right fix required to correct the matter.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Ability to follow rules and procedure.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Knowledge of working with Electrical circuits and equipment.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Ability to work outside in all weather conditions and to use all PPE provided for those conditions.<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Offer ID<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    61016BR\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Metier<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    Maintenance \n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Employment type<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    Regular position \n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Experience level required<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    Minimum 3 years \n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Branch<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    Marketing &amp; Team, reporting to the SDM Lead in Aberdeen.\n    <br> \n    <br> Interested parties should apply by the closing date of the \n    <b>29th January 2023<\u002Fb>.\n    <br> \n    <br> Activities include:\n    <ul>\n     <li> Drive and supervise Geographical Information Service (GIS) for the affiliate, to include production of complex cartographic documents using HQ technical specifications, procedures &amp; standards, rules &amp; processes, in order to meet the spatial data needs of the assets and technical services stakeholders.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Ensure [GIS] data requests to prepare, capture, search, transfer and QC data are fulfilled for TEPUK or external parties to meet stakeholder needs within the scope and priorities of the service.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> In partnership with key stakeholders, support surface data management activities to ensure the implementation and continuous improvement of data capture and quality methods across the Assets and Technical Services and aligned to the overall surface data management roadmap and data governance framework.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Apply and respect UK national regulatory requirements (NSTA), ensuring that mandatory reporting is completed within defined timescales to the NDR (National Data Repository) and progress is communicated to key stakeholders.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Define and monitor KPIs to show status and progress on surface data capture and data quality (including NSTA reporting), and identify issue and opportunities to improve.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Coordinate, drive and deliver project activities related to geospatial or surface data, supporting the overall data strategy and a move towards cloud storage and adoption of data platforms such as Quantium, CDP and OSDU.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Maintain and update documentation on data management workflows and processes and champion the adoption of data visualisation to outline data landscape and ensure knowledge capitalization. <\u002Fli>\n     <li>Identify, engage support for and develop innovative use cases\u002Fprojects to improve data management, migration or data quality including AI use\n      <ul>\n       <li> Build PBI dashboards to monitor the performance on data capture and availability <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Work to align current systems towards future digital platform architecture<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Build scripts and queries to ease\u002Fimprove data management activity (Python, SQL or DAX)<\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful><\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n    <ul>\n     <li> Explore and provide trainings on data management tools and techniques (NDR website, Geographical Information Services plugins, transfer data between tools) to enhance user understanding and capabilities, working in partnership with data coordinator network (DCN) and HQ teams to collaborate and support the embedding of data management competencies and process within each surface data domain of the business.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Implement procedures to ensure that the data management activities are compliant with E&amp;P Referential: company policies, procedures, standards and rules (naming conventions, organisation, workflows and confidentiality) to ensure data capture, flow and quality with adherence to deadlines.<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Context and environment<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    TEPUK is currently one of the largest operators on the UK Continental Shelf (UKCS) in terms of production and reserves, with average daily production of 201,000 barrels of oil equivalent per day (boe\u002Fd) in 2020.\n    <br> \n    <br> TEPUK employs around 1000 people, split between its onshore sites and its offshore facilities.\n    <br> \n    <br> TEPUK operates four core areas in the North Sea, covering:\n    <br> \n    <br> \n    <ul>\n     <li>Intensive development of mature fields and nearby exploration in the Northern North Sea area,<\u002Fli>\n     <li>HPHT exploration and infill development in the Central Graben area,<\u002Fli>\n     <li>Deep offshore exploration and development in the environmentally sensitive West of Shetland area.<\u002Fli>\n     <li>Development of mature fields in the greater ENS area.<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n    <br> Maps of TEPUKâ€™s assets can be consulted here.\n    <br> \n    <ul>\n     <li> In response to the company ambition and strategy for data driven performance the new TDM function within technical services will lead the affiliate in defining and implementing the data foundation through effective data governance. <\u002Fli>\n     <li>The TDM mission is to drive a strong data management culture through the showcasing and delivery of best practices and knowledge transfer.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> In a fast-paced high evolution domain there is a requirement for continuous improvement and adaptation of new methodologies and competences, whilst complying with the confidentiality and security implications of the data being managed.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Surface Data Management has a strategic focus within TotalEnergies and fundamental to the facilitation and efficient utilisation of data as an asset within TEPUK.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> The development of robust Surface Data Management is required to support modern business practices within TEPUK.<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Candidate profile<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    We welcome applications from candidates who have the following qualifications and experience:\n    <ul>\n     <li> At least a BSc degree in Geographical Information Services or Computer Science disciplines with significant professional experience or reasonable work experience in an oil Exploration &amp; Production environment<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Proven technical skills in Geographical Information Systems, (ESRI software, inc ArcSDE and ArcGIS Server, FME, AGOL), geodesy and general knowledge of spatial data analysis techniques.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Proven understanding of the UK regulatory data rules for Offshore Energy <\u002Fli>\n     <li>Experience of working within a Power BI based reporting environment. <\u002Fli>\n     <li>Experience writing robust, reusable code to create production-strength data pipelines<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Excellent knowledge of ETL tools (SafeFME) and scripting in Python, SQL.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Experience of cloud platforms, features, and capabilities (Microsoft Azure components) specifically Azure Data Factory<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Organised, methodical and able to multi-task whilst working under tight deadlines<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Behavioral skills: self motivated, autonomy, open-mindedness, adaptability, achievement orientation, team player<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Offer ID<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    67562BR\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n
